snippet: Dogfighting, videotaping, drug use, bullying and texting are among the misdeeds that have drawn penalties from the N.F.L., punishments that have seemed inconsistent and arbitrary to some.
abstract: Four-game suspension handed down to New England Patriot's quarterback Tom Brady, along with $1 million fine for team, seems severe in comparison to penalties issued by NFL for long list of previous infractions, including drug use, bullying and dogfighting; is harsher, for example, than two-game suspension given to Baltimore Ravens running back Ray Rice for assaulting his fiancee.
lead_paragraph: Dogfighting, videotaping, drug use, bullying and texting are among the misdeeds that have drawn penalties from the N.F.L., punishments that have seemed inconsistent and arbitrary to some.

headline.main: N.F.L. Presides Over a Long List of Misconduct
